lead_paragraph: The candidates and their surrogates hopscotched across the United States in the final, frenzied hours of the campaign, with the nation reduced to a string of must-win states.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nicholas Fandos, Thomas Kaplan, Nick Corasaniti and Sheryl Gay Stolberg.
byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO, ASHLEY PARKER and AMY CHOZICK

headline.print_headline: Clashing Final Pitches In Swing-State Blitz
headline.main: Optimism From Hillary Clinton and Darkness From Donald Trump at Campaign’s End

snippet: The candidates and their surrogates hopscotched across the United States in the final, frenzied hours of the campaign, with the nation reduced to a string of must-win states....
abstract: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump make closing arguments to voters in frenzied final hours of 2016 presidential campaign; Clinton makes case for herself as defender of freedom and equality, and underscores historic nature of her candidacy, while Trump promises to thoroughly shake up political establishment.
